formattedAddress: 165 W 73rd St, New York, NY 10023, USA
adrFormatAddress: 165 W 73rd St, New York, NY 10023, USA

originalText.text: I pay $2,800 a month to live in an upscale building in Asbury Park NJ. I have lived with cockroaches for over a year. Exterminator comes out and does nothing when we ask, the cockroaches continue to pop up. More recently all of my neighbors have been telling me about mice in their apartments and sure enough I now have mice(probably the cleanest home you would ever enter) constantly cleaned professionally and personally multiple times a week. One property manager promised and guaranteed us they would move us out with no penalties due to these issues to any sackman property available, well we found out that was a lie by another property manager. The buildings are infested and the management is poor. Such a shame.

One property manager promised and guaranteed us they would move us out with no penalties due to these issues to any sackman property available, well we found out that was a lie by another property manager. The buildings are infested and the management is poor. Such a shame.

originalText.text:
Having lived in a Sackman owned and managed building for 10.5 years, contrary to some other reviews here, I have to say I never really had a bad experience.  Our building was well maintained and clean, our super, Edvin, was very responsive and did a great job keeping the building looking great.

The office staff over the years were always helpful and nice, and had nothing but great interactions with Executive Property Manager, Cynthia and Property Manager Alex.  Any concerns and questions were immediately addressed.

Had I not needed to move a little closer to my job, I would’ve loved to stay in my old apartment for years to come.

originalText.text: The way they communicate is through ignoring. Ignoring heat issues, leaking ceilings, poor upkeep of the property. If you are looking for a management company that actually responds to whatever the inquiry is, this is not it. Be warned.

text.text: The way they communicate is through ignoring. Ignoring heat issues, leaking ceilings, poor upkeep of the property. If you are looking for a management company that actually responds to whatever the inquiry is, this is not it. Be warned.

originalText.text: They are rude, money hungry sharks. Please beware that all they care about is money and not the quality of living being provided. When they found out I wasn’t renewing my lease (after they raised the rent almost $500) they ignored my calls for weeks on end. And when I moved the remainder of my furniture a day late they kept my entire deposit. They lied and said it was because they had an open house they’d have to cancel, but that wasn’t true and nothing was ever scheduled. I know of someone who abruptly quit working them. The manger is rude and will hang up on you. Their rent is overpriced! The floors are paper thin and you hear stomping from neighbors, the heater doesn’t work and you’ll spend winter months freezing. Not worth it. Good riddance sackman

originalText.text: I have lived in a Sackman building for several years, and the quality of management has declined dramatically this year. The five buildings Sackman manages on my street have all had cockroach infestations since the summer. For months, management made only half-hearted attempts to respond, then finally began to take more aggressive action in the last two weeks in the face of escalating tenant complaints. Yet the roach sightings continue. Other serious apartment health hazards have gone unaddressed for weeks on end, and when tenants raise issues, we are ignored or face outright hostility from management.
